meanings.definition: Having happened or been decided before something else.
meanings.sent1: The foregone conclusion left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent2: It was a foregone conclusion that the sun would rise in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The foregone decision to have ice cream for dinner made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her foregone victory in the race was celebrated by all.
meanings.sent5: The foregone outcome of the game was etched in everyone's minds.

meanings.sent1: The foregone storm caused everyone to prepare.
meanings.sent2: It was a foregone event that the flowers would bloom in spring.
meanings.sent3: The foregone rain made the picnic more exciting.
meanings.sent4: His foregone success in the exam was a relief.
meanings.sent5: The foregone party was eagerly anticipated by all.
